articles.title: U.S. Secretary of State's Anti-DPRK Rhetoric Blasted
articles.content:
U.S. Secretary of State's Anti-DPRK Rhetoric Blasted
Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK Thursday gave the following answer to a question raised by KCNA, blasting the anti-DPRK vituperation let loose by U.S. Secretary of State Hillary Clinton:
					She has made a spate of vulgar remarks unbecoming for her position everywhere she went since she was sworn in. 
					
					She said during her recent trip to India that "north Korea should not receive the attention it is seeking through behavior like missile launches," likening Pyongyang's behavior to that of unruly children. Her words suggest that she is by no means intelligent. 
					
					The DPRK has taken necessary measures to protect the nation's sovereignty and right to existence to cope with the U.S. hostile policy and nuclear threat, not to attract anyone's attention.
					
					The U.S., however, is taking the lead in making much ado about nothing. 
					
					It was the U.S. that helped the DPRK to become the world focus. 
					
					We cannot but regard Mrs. Clinton as a funny lady as she likes to utter such rhetoric, unaware of the elementary etiquette in the international community. 
					
					Sometimes she looks like a primary schoolgirl and sometimes a pensioner going shopping. 
					
					Anyone making misstatements has to pay for them.
					
					 It is our view that she can make even a little contribution to the implementation of the U.S. administration's foreign policy as secretary of State only when she has understanding of the world, to begin with.

articles.title: Greetings to Egyptian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Egyptian President
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of greetings to Muhammad Hosni Mubarak, President of Egypt, on the occasion of the 57th anniversary of the July 23 revolution, an auspicious holiday of the Egyptian people.
					 Kim in the message sincerely wished the president and people of Egypt greater success in the efforts to defend the stability of the country and achieve its economic development and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Prime Minister of Egypt
articles.content:
Greetings to Prime Minister of Egypt
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Kim Yong Il Wednesday sent a message of greetings to Ahmed Najef, Prime Minister of Egypt, on the occasion of the 57th anniversary of the July 23 revolution, a significant national holiday of the Egyptian people.
					 The message wished the prime minister and the government of Egypt great success in their efforts to offset the negative effects by the worldwide financial crisis and ensure the stable economic development.

articles.title: Congratulations to PM of Peru
articles.content:
Congratulations to PM of Peru
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Kim Yong Il on July 16 sent a congratulatory message to Javier Velasquez Quesquen upon his appointment as Prime Minister of Peru.
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop, the message wished him success in his new job.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Meets New Brazilian Ambassador
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Meets New Brazilian Ambassador
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- Pak Ui Chun, foreign minister of the DPRK, had a talk with Arnaldo  Carrilho, Brazilian ambassador newly accredited to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday when the latter paid a courtesy call on him.

articles.title: Reception Given by Cuban Embassy
articles.content:
Reception Given by Cuban Embassy
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- Enrique Montoto Cruz, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Cuban embassy here, arranged a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club on July 22 to mark the 56th anniversary of the attack on Moncada Barrack.
					 Present there on invitation were Kim Yong Jin, minister of Education and chairman of the Korean Committee for Solidarity with Cuba, Kim Thae Jong, vice department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and officials concerned.
					
					 Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: Congratulations to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, received a floral basket and a congratulatory letter from the Military Attaches Corps here on the occasion of the 56th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War. 
					 The basket and letter were handed to an official concerned by Miguel Angel Gala Valiente, military attache of the Cuban embassy who is doyen of the corps, on Thursday.

articles.title: New Botanical Garden at Foot of Mt. Paektu
articles.content:
New Botanical Garden at Foot of Mt. Paektu
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- An army-people botanical garden has made its appearance at the foot of Mt. Paektu in the northern tip of Korea.
					More than 300,000 tree saplings of various species were planted at the foot of Hohang Pass where one can enjoy a bird's-eye view of Samjiyon county town, forming a wonderful flora.
					
					Lots of trees peculiar to the area of Mt. Paektu including larch, rowan, azalea and royal azalea grow in the garden.
					
					There are not a small number of trees rare to be seen in the area such as wild pear tree, oak tree and linden tree. It has also fields of edible herbs, medicinal herbs and plants with beautiful flowers.
					
					Good species of trees suitable to the northern alpine region are also growing well.
					
					Scores of species of tree saplings and flower shrubs grow thick in the vast area of 20-odd hectares with tall trees as fence.
					
					Two peculiar natural overlooking stands have been arranged in the garden furnished with all conditions necessary for its management.
					
					The botanical garden built in the highest area of Korea comprehensively shows all kinds of trees growing in the northern areas.

articles.title: New Artificial Crystalline Lens Developed
articles.content:
New Artificial Crystalline Lens Developed
Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- A new kind of artificial crystalline lens has of late been developed in the DPRK to enjoy a good popularity.
					It, called "artificial ductile acryl crystalline lens", is an up-to-date medical material for the treatment of cataract.
					
					It has already been applied to patients suffering from cataract by the ophthalmic special hospital under the Korea General Red-Cross Hospital with the result that many patients recovered their sight.
					
					The newly developed crystalline lens is cheap in production cost and high in quality as compared to those in other countries. It helps make the incision part smaller by far, thus remarkably shortening the recovering days.
					
					It causes no aftereffect such as astigmatism.
					
					Ophthalmic doctors say that the development of the crystalline lens is an innovative achievement in ophthalmic field of the country.

articles.title: Songun Politics Based on New Elucidation of Main Force in Revolution
articles.content:
Songun Politics Based on New Elucidation of Main Force in Revolution
Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- Songun politics is displaying its great might in the DPRK. Its vitality is boundless because it is based on a new elucidation of the main force in the revolution.
					Which class or group of the society is taken as the main force of the revolution is a basic problem for the party leading the revolution to strengthen revolutionary forces and triumphantly carry out the cause of the popular masses for independence.
					
					The preceding revolutionary theory, on the basis of the analysis of the social and class relations in the then developed capitalist countries, defined the working class as the main force of the revolution. It had long been regarded as an inexorable law.
					
					As the social and class relations and the balance of forces change according to the progress of the times and the development of the reality, the question of the main force in the revolution cannot remain invariable.
					
					The Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) has put up the people's army as the main force of revolution on a scientific analysis of its characteristics and role.
					
					The revolutionary army is made up with fine core members, the vanguard fighters, among the laboring classes and strata such as workers, peasants and intellectuals and stands at the outpost of the serious and acute armed struggle. It, therefore, is the collective strongest in revolutionary spirit and fighting strength.
					
					The revolutionary army with organization and discipline, attributes of the armed ranks, as its life and soul cannot be matched by any other collectives of the society in the revolutionary spirit, the united might and the combat capacity.
					
					The revolutionary idea and spirit of the revolutionary army which has been consolidated in struggle are the main source making it play a vanguard and active role in the socialist construction, too.
					
					The WPK has resorted all along to an energetic Songun revolutionary leadership from the 1960s. It has clarified the law of developing revolutionary cause which is pioneered and advanced in reliance upon the leading and pivotal role of the revolutionary army and opened up a new chapter of the socialist politics depending on the might of the army.
					
					The validity and vitality of the Songun politics of the WPK are being displayed to the full in the revolutionary practice.

articles.title: High Degree of Working Class Consciousness Called for
articles.content:
High Degree of Working Class Consciousness Called for
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- All the people can perform astonishing miracles and feats when they wage a high-pitched drive, fully determined to demonstrate once again the spirit of heroic Korea before the enemies by bringing about a great surge on all fronts of socialist construction.
					Rodong Sinmun Thursday observes this in a signed article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					The above-said consciousness serves as a source of strength that reinforces the will of everybody to devotedly implement the militant tasks given by the Workers' Party of Korea under any circumstances. It also serves as an ideological and moral factor of making a clean sweep of everything outdated and backward standing in the way of advance and firmly adhering to the revolutionary principle, the socialist principle. It, at the same time, serves as a spiritual motive force for making a greater leap forward and advancing faster with strong national self-esteem.
					
					The more than decade during which the DPRK has advanced under the banner of Songun clearly proves what tremendous strength the people having the above-said class consciousness have displayed in the course of upholding the idea and will of their great leader. 
					
					The Korean people have stronger working class consciousness than any other people. Had they lacked that consciousness, they would not have remained true to their revolutionary principle and faith in the worst adversity nor would have brought about the present stirring reality of socialism whose dignity is glorified thanks to Songun. 
					
					As shown by the Korean people's history of building a rich and powerful country, the might of socialism finds its expression, above all, in the strong mental power of the servicepersons and people of the DPRK and their high degree of working class consciousness. 
					
					 It is the exceptional revolutionary resolution and patriotic zeal of the Korean people in the Songun era to perform miracles and heroic feats in the 150-day campaign and thus make this year an eventful year to be specially recorded in the history of the WPK, concludes the article.

articles.title: Vigilance against Imperialists' "Strategy of Peaceful Transition" Called for
articles.content:
Vigilance against Imperialists' "Strategy of Peaceful Transition" Called for
Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- The aggressive and predatory nature of imperialism can never change. If there be any change it is a change in its methods of aggression, not in its nature. 
					Rodong Sinmun Thursday observes this in a signed article.
					
					The policy of strength veiled with "peace" strategy is one of the main methods employed by the imperialists at present, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					It is the general strategic goal of the imperialists to stamp out the world's independent forces with the policy of strength, a war strategy, and turn the whole world into a unipolar one dominated by them in a bid to exercise the unlimited right to domination. 
					
					It is also part of the imperialists' principal methods of aggression to enforce the policy of strength in combination with the strategy to monopolize resources.
					
					That is why the imperialists are vying with each other to reorganize and relocate their armed forces in the main areas rich in resources and the areas of military strategic importance. 
					
					It is the unchangeable aggressive nature of the imperialists to try to get rid of the economic crisis and the crisis of resources by means of a war.
					
					The imperialists' "strategy of peaceful transition" serves as a major means for realizing their wild ambition for aggression and domination at present.
					
					One should not make any unprincipled compromise with the imperialists, failing to have proper understanding of the unchangeable nature of imperialism and nurturing illusion about them. Doing so is little short of conniving at the imperialists' moves for aggression, war and domination and helping them.
					
					All countries should not tolerate the imperialists' aggression and war, arbitrary and high-handed practices in the international arena but protect their own sovereign rights and interests, firmly maintaining an anti-imperialist independent stand.

articles.title: Anti-Lee Myung Bak Struggle Called for
articles.content:
Anti-Lee Myung Bak Struggle Called for
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- The Youth and Students Solidarity for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration of south Korea held a conference on July 18 and issued an appeal titled "Let's turn out in all-out struggle to force Lee Myung Bak to step down".
					 The appeal said the prevailing situation calls upon all the people on this land to turn out in the all-out confrontation with the fascist dictatorship.
					
					As long as brazen-faced Lee stays in power, the south Korean society will remain a tundra of democracy, a theater of confrontation and war and a society for big businessmen, it said, calling upon all the people to launch a struggle under the same slogan demanding Lee step down.
					
					All the people, regardless of whether they are workers and farmers struggling to protect the right to existence, professors and scholars of conscience, those from all walks of life waging the movement to issue declarations on the situation and justice-loving brave youth and students, should turn out in the struggle to force Lee to step down in order to fulfil their historic responsibility, the appeal urged. 
					
					 It called for building a new society, independent, democratic and reunified, through an all-out struggle to force Lee to step down.

articles.title: Probe into Truth about Tragedy in Ryongsan Demanded
articles.content:
Probe into Truth about Tragedy in Ryongsan Demanded
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- The Democratic Labor Party of south Korea issued a statement on July 20 demanding a probe into the truth behind the killing of evacuees in Ryongsan. 
					 The statement said: It is half a year since the tragedy in Ryongsan, but the truth about it has not yet been probed and the bereaved families of the dead have not yet been able to hold funerals for them. 
					
					 What happened in Ryongsan was obviously a murder committed by the dictatorial regime, but no one owns responsibility for it and the prosecution and the police are brutally suppressing the actions to mourn the deaths of evacuees on charges of "illegal acts and terror", defending each other. 
					
					 Lee should not turn his face away from the tragedy in Ryongsan any longer, keenly aware that people are closely watching his attitude towards the issue. 
					
					 The Lee regime should opt to settle the tragedy in Ryongsan as early as possible and make a sincere apology for the killing of evacuees, if it wants to escape the people's criticism.

articles.title: KCTU Calls General Strike
articles.content:
KCTU Calls General Strike
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions declared it would call a general strike in all the areas of south Korea including Seoul and Kyonggi Province from July 22.
					The KCTU called a press conference in Seoul on July 21. It said that the general strike is an action in protest against the authorities' suppression of unionists of Ssangyong Motor Co. and their moves to railroad "MB evil bills" including the bill on the revision of the "law on part-time job" and the "bill on media."
					
					The KCTU charged that the authorities' merciless suppression of unionists of Ssangyong Motor Co. indicates that they have no intention to settle the situation. 
					
					Recalling that the wife of a unionist committed a suicide in protest against the suppression, the organization declared it was obviously murder by the side of the company owner and the authorities.
					
					It accused the "Grand National Party" of working hard to ram the evil bills through the current "extraordinary session of the National Assembly" at any cost despite the unanimous opposition of the people.
					
					The KCTU warned that it would launch an all-out anti-"government" struggle if the authorities railroad the evil bills through the NA and persist in their crackdown upon the actions of unionists of the above-said company.

articles.title: Death Anniversary of Kim Il Sung Observed in Different Countries
articles.content:
Death Anniversary of Kim Il Sung Observed in Different Countries
Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- A remembrance meeting, a lecture, a reading session, book and photo exhibitions and films shows took place in Pakistan, Kyrgyzstan, Ethiopia and Austria between July 5 and 7 to commemorate the 15th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					Displayed in the venues of the events were works of the President and General Secretary
						Kim Jong Il, photos on the immortal feats of three commanders of Mt. Paektu and books and photos on the true looks of Songun Korea.
					
					 Taji Haider, ex-senator from the Pakistan People's Party, the chief of the Society for the Study of Juche of Pakistan and other speakers at the remembrance meeting praised Kim Il Sung as the remarkable thinker and theoretician, prominent strategist and tender-hearted father of the people. They stressed that the Juche idea founded by him serves as the most scientific guiding idea in the era of independence.
					
					 A. Usupbayev, chairman of the Central Council of the People Unity-"Kyrgyz El" Republican Political Party, noted in the lecture under the subject of "Immortal President Kim Il Sung" that the President founded the Juche idea and the Songun idea to provide the immortal guidelines for independence.
					
					 His lifelong intention and cause have been creditably carried forward by Kim Jong Il, the lecturer said.
					
					 The secretary general of the Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea at the reading session praised Kim Il Sung's brilliant revolutionary career, saying that his august name and undying feats will shine forever with the century.
					
					 Korean films including "Arms of the DPRK" were shown at the film shows.
					
					 A message to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the remembrance meeting in Pakistan.

articles.title: Exploits of Kim Hyong Jik Praised
articles.content:
Exploits of Kim Hyong Jik Praised
Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- The 115th birth anniversary of Kim Hyong Jik, an indomitable revolutionary fighter and outstanding leader of the anti-Japanese national liberation movement in Korea, was commemorated in different countries.
					A reading session on "Father and Korean National Association" from Chapter 1 of the first volume of Part 1 "The Anti-Japanese Revolution" of "With the Century", reminiscences of President
						Kim Il Sung, was held by the Youth Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Democratic Congo and a seminar by the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea "Kanggye" of Colombia on July 10.
					
					Nzemba Yangana, chairman of the Democratic Congolese group, said at the reading session that the national liberation, desired so ardently by Kim Hyong Jik in his lifetime was realized through the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle organized by Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Jairo Gonzalez, chairman of the Colombian group, said at the seminar that Kim Hyong Jik devoted all his life to the struggle for liberating the country from the Japanese imperialists' military occupation and that he formed the Korean National Association and led the national liberation movement of Korea as a whole.
					
					 He provided an ideological and moral source of the Juche idea, the guiding idea and doctrine of socialist Korea, the chairman noted, adding that the present reality of the DPRK is what he desired.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Repressive Campaign Flayed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Repressive Campaign Flayed
 Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- Cuautemoc Amezcua Dromundo, first secretary of the C.C., the Socialist Popular Party of Mexico, issued a statement on July 12 to denounce the Lee Myung Bak group for its crackdown upon the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon).
					 The Lee group's suppression of the core members of the headquarters is arousing towering rage from political parties, governments and organizations of various countries and the progressive people heartily hoping for Korea's reunification, the statement noted.
					
					 Lee Myung Bak is a heinous separatist as he totally negated the historic June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and pushed the favorably developing inter-Korean relations into the worst crisis of total severance and confrontation as soon as he came to power, it said, and went on:
					
					 All the members of the Socialist Popular Party of Mexico bitterly condemn the indiscreet and anachronistic moves of the Lee group which nullified the inter-Korean declarations and brought back the era of fascist dictatorship and is getting hell-bent on inter-Korean confrontation.
					
					We strongly demand that the Lee group apologize to all the Korean people at once for its crackdown upon the South Headquarters of Pomminryon and release the unreasonably arrested core members of the headquarters unconditionally and immediately.
					
					We hold that Korea's reunification should be realized by the concerted efforts of all the Koreans in the idea of "By our nation itself" under the banner of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, great programme for independent reunification provided by Kim Jong Il, the great leader of the Korean people, after wiping out the Lee Myung Bak group and other anti-reunification forces.

articles.title: U.S. and Its Followers Urged to Halt Their Hostile Acts against DPRK
articles.content:
U.S. and Its Followers Urged to Halt Their Hostile Acts against DPRK
Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- All the members of the Vanguard Party of Indonesia strongly demand the U.S. and its followers stop at once their hostile acts against the DPRK in order to ensure peace on the Korean Peninsula.
					Ristiyanto, secretary general of the National Guidance Council of the party, urged this in a statement issued on July 14 in the run-up to the 56th anniversary of the victorious great Fatherland Liberation War in Korea.
					
					The statement went on:
					
					More than half a century has passed since the Korean War ceased, but peace has not yet settled on the peninsula and the situation remains tense there due to the U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK.
					
					The Korean people were compelled to steadily bolster the capability for self-defence to protect the sovereignty of the country from the nuclear threat of the U.S. The nuclear issue in the peninsula is, in essence, a product of the U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK.
					
					It was none other than the U.S. that compelled the DPRK to have access to nuclear weapons and instigated the UN Security Council to adopt the "resolution on sanctions" to stifle the DPRK, the statement noted, and continued:
					
					It is preposterous for the U.S. to claim that the satellite launch by the DPRK only was a violation of international law while being free to launch satellites.
					
					That was why the DPRK categorically turned down the UNSC "resolution on sanctions," terming it a product of the U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK.
					
					All the members of the Vanguard Party of Indonesia express full support and solidarity with the DPRK in its just stand and measures to defend its sovereignty.

articles.title: Se fundara nuevo ministerio en la RPDC
articles.content:
Se fundara nuevo ministerio en la RPDC
Pyongyang, 23 de julio (ATCC) -- Segun el decreto fechado 22 del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, se instaurara el Ministerio de la Industria Alimentaria y de Necesidades Diarias.

articles.title: MINREX refuta disparates de la secretaria de Estado de EE.UU.
articles.content:
MINREX refuta disparates de la secretaria de Estado de EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 23 de julio (ATCC) -- En entrevista concedida este jueves con la Agencia Telegrafica Central de Corea en relacion con que la secretaria de Estado de Estados Unidos pronuncia sucesivamente las palabras insultantes a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, el portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la RPDC dio la siguiente respuesta:
					Desde que fue designada, la secretaria de Estado Hillary Clinton pronuncia sucesivamente por doquier unas palabras vulgares y absurdas sobre nuestro pais, que sientan mal a su cargo.
					
					En su reciente viaje a la India, ella comparo el lanzamiento de misiles, que hemos realizado recientemente como parte del ejercicio militar, con la conducta de un nino inquieto que quiere atraer la atencion a si mismo.
					
					Y dijo que "aunque el Norte de Corea quiere estar en el centro de la escena, EE.UU. no le daria ese placer".
					
					Escuchando estas palabras, no podemos percibir ninguna intelectualidad de ella.
					
					Estamos tomando las medidas necesarias no para llamar la atencion de alguien sino para defender la soberania y el derecho a la vida de nuestra nacion frente a la politica hostil y la amenaza nuclear de EE.UU. 
					
					Al respecto, EE.UU. esta tomando la delantera en armar escandalos por gusto.
					
					Por consiguiente, nos colocamos en el centro de la escena gracias a EE.UU.
					
					Nos parece ridicula ella que prefiere la verborragia ignorando la elemental caracteristica fisiologica de la sociedad internacional.
					
					Ella parece a veces una alumna de la primaria y otras veces, una abuela que necesita ser mantenida y no tiene otra tarea que ir al mercado.
					
					Las malas palabras deben pagar su precio.
					
					Nos viene a la mente la idea de que si ella es secretaria de Estado, debe tener primero los conocimientos del mundo para contribuir, aunque en lo minimo, a la implementacion de la politica exterior de su administracion.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il felicita a su homologo peruano
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il felicita a su homologo peruano
Pyongyang, 23 de julio (ATCC) -- El primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Il, envio el dia 16 un mensaje de felicitacion a su homologo de la Republica Peruana, Javier Velasquez Quesquen, con motivo de su nombramiento a este cargo.
					 El remitente expresa su conviccion de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises seguiran desarrollandose y le desea al destinatario exitos en el cumplimiento de su nuevo cargo.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun se reune con el nuevo embajador brasileno
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun se reune con el nuevo embajador brasileno
 Pyongyang, 23 de julio (ATCC) -- El canciller coreano, Pak Ui Chun, departio el dia 23 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con el nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la Republica Federativa de Brasil en Corea, Arnaldo Carrilho, quien le hizo una visita de cortesia.
